txt.en:
'The orders you captured from the Angmarim have made several things clear now. The Angmarim do indeed hold the Jä-koru, but they have no intention of turning it over until Forochel lies safely within their grasp.

'Nevertheless, to silence the doubts of the Hylje-heimo, they were recently obliged to bring the Jä-koru into Forochel to prove their claim. Now is the time to strike and reclaim the Jä-koru before they return it to some dark vault in Angmar. It is in the keeping of one of their most trusted captains, a man named Roibeard. He has made camp somewhere within the fortifications of the Ironspan.

'I must ask you to infiltrate that fortress by whatever means possible and wrest the Jä-koru from him.'

'Can it truly be? We had thought ourselves cursed by fate and never to see it again, but you have truly brought it -- the Jä-koru!'\n\n'[placeholder], your name will go on in song and story for many generations to come as the one who restored to us our greatest treasure!'
'You must find the Jä-koru, [placeholder]. Time is running out and soon it will slip from our grasp forever....'
Esko has told you that the Hylje-heimo may be swayed to side with the Free Peoples of the South if the Jewel of Ice can be recovered.
Bring the Jewel of Ice to Esko at Pynti-peldot

Roibeard is at the Angmarim encampments near the Ironspan, north-east of Pynti-peldot.\n\nEsko has told you where the Angmarim are holding the Jewel of Ice. You must retrieve it before it can be returned to the vaults of Angmar.
